intro: Euphorbia pycnostegia var. laxa, commonly known as the woolly euphorbia, is a succulent plant native to South Africa. It features a short, thick stem with dense, woolly foliage that gives it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers in clusters, which are surrounded by modified leaves called bracts. It is adapted to arid environments and requires minimal water, making it suitable for rock gardens or xeriscaping. Its unique morphology and drought tolerance make it a popular choice among succulent enthusiasts.
